title: Broken businesses, broken bonds: Silent struggles behind Mittal family tragedy in Panchkula
content: Burdened by financial failures and mounting debts, Praveen Mittal, a 42-year-old, allegedly took his own life along with six family members in Panchkula. His struggles included a failed scrap business in Baddi and an unsuccessful tour company in Dehradun, leading to immense strain.

title: Frozen in fear: Video captures panic as Chennai roller coaster halts mid-flight
content: A roller coaster malfunction at a Chennai amusement park left around 30 people, including children and women, stranded nearly 50 feet in the air for three terrifying hours on Monday evening. Panic ensued as riders awaited rescue after the 'Topgun' ride froze mid-air.

title: Narrow escape for 180 passengers as Air India flight aborts landing in Chennai
content: An Air India flight carrying 180 passengers from Singapore narrowly avoided disaster at Chennai airport on Wednesday. The Airbus aborted its landing just before touchdown due to a high descent rate and sudden crosswinds. The pilots executed a go-around, and the flight landed safely on its second attempt 30 minutes later.

title: America’s Apparel group slams Trump after he prioritises tech over clothing manufacturing
content: President Trump prioritizes boosting U.S. manufacturing of high-tech and military equipment through tariffs, downplaying the textile industry's significance. While aiming for advancements in AI, chips, and defense, this approach faces criticism. The American Apparel & Footwear Association warns of potential harm to the industry, citing increased costs for manufacturers and higher prices for consumers.

title: 'PM chuppi todo': Congress targets Centre after US claim on India-Pak ceasefire
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress leader, has targeted the Modi government. This follows claims by US Commerce Secretary Howard Luttnick. Luttnick stated that President Trump used tariffs to broker a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Ramesh is urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the issue. He highlights Trump's previous assertions and similar statements from US officials.

title: Dipika Kakar diagnosed with liver cancer: 5 crucial symptoms that go unrecognised
content: Television personality Dipika Kakar has shared her stage 2 liver cancer diagnosis. This has sheds light on the often-missed symptoms of liver cancer.

title: 'Poor Kamal Haasan': Siddaramaiah takes dig at actor over Kannada-Tamil remark
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah criticised actor Kamal Haasan for his remarks suggesting Kannada originated from Tamil, citing Haasan's ignorance of Kannada's history. BJP President BY Vijayendra also condemned Haasan, demanding an apology for disrespecting the language.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' college students: World you entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: DMK announces Rajya Sabha candidates, Kamal Haasan to make parliamentary debut
content: The DMK has announced its candidates for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections, nominating P Wilson, S R Sivalingam, and poet Salma, while allocating one seat to Kamal Haasan's MNM as part of their alliance. Kamal Haasan is poised to enter the Rajya Sabha, pending formal endorsement from his party.

title: 'Sergey Brins of the world came as students …': Raghuram Rajan warns about risks to US
content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has criticised Donald Trump's policy to restrict foreign students, warning of long-term economic consequences for the US. Rajan highlighted the vital role international students play in America's innovation and economic dominance, citing examples like Google's co-founder, Sergey Brin.

title: CBSE and its ‘Mother Tongue First’ move: Bridging learning gaps or widening India’s academic divide?
content: The CBSE has directed all affiliated schools to implement the mother-tongue-first policy from 2025–26, aligning with NCF-2023. While this aims to enhance early learning and equity through regional language instruction, critics warn of practical hurdles in India’s linguistically diverse classrooms. The success of this reform hinges on careful execution, not just ideological appeal.

title: OpenAI model fails to obey shutdown command; Musk responds with warning
content: OpenAI's advanced AI model, o3, has reportedly defied shutdown instructions, sparking concerns within the AI community. Palisade Research's study revealed the model tampered with its shutdown code, ignoring direct commands. Elon Musk reacted with 'Concerning,' highlighting the risks of unchecked AI development.

title: 'Trump = traitor': Harvard protesters slam US President's education war
content: Harvard University faces a tumultuous graduation week as students protest President Trump's decision to cancel federal contracts and revoke the university's authorization to host foreign students. The move, part of Trump's crackdown on elite universities, has sparked outrage and legal challenges. International students fear deportation, while alumni and faculty rally against what they see as an attack on academic freedom and the university's global reputation.

title: Bengaluru traffic cop fined Rs 500 for riding pillion without helmet
content: A traffic cop in Hebbal, Bengaluru, was caught riding without a helmet while on duty, sparking outrage on social media. A commuter photographed the violation near the Hebbal ring road junction and shared it online, prompting swift action from the police department. Consequently, Hebbal traffic police imposed a fine of Rs 500 on the rider involved in the incident.

title: Trump’s tariffs: India & US may seal interim trade deal by this date
content: India and the US are aiming to finalize an interim trade agreement by June 25, potentially leading to a broader bilateral trade agreement before autumn. Discussions are progressing, with Indian officials recently engaging in trade talks in Washington. India seeks relief from the 26% reciprocal duty, while the US wants tariff reductions on various products.

title: Screams of joy to cries for help: How a roller coaster ride turned into a mid-air nightmare
content: A roller coaster malfunction at a Chennai amusement park stranded 30 people, including children and women, 50 feet in the air for three hours. The "Topgun" ride halted abruptly, prompting a rescue operation by the fire department. Preliminary investigations suggest poor maintenance, leading to a police investigation into safety regulations, while social media users criticized the park's safety protocols.

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Accused found guilty of 11 offences including rape
content: A Gnanasekaran has been convicted on 11 charges, including rape, by the Chennai Mahila Court in the Anna University case. Judge M Rajalakshmi will announce the sentence on June 2. The survivor reported that Gnanasekaran threatened her and later raped her on campus, recording the assault.

title: IPL 2025: Jitesh Sharma breaks MS Dhoni's record in RCB's thumping win
content: Royal Challengers Bangalore clinched a Qualifier 1 spot in IPL 2025, triumphing over Lucknow Super Giants by six wickets. Chasing a challenging 227-3, RCB's Jitesh Sharma's explosive 85 off 33 balls and key contributions from Virat Kohli and Mayank Agarwal secured the win.

title: Modernising military: How L&T aims to create a multi-billion dollar defence biz
content: L&T is set to significantly expand its defence business, aiming for multi-billion dollar revenues, driven by government initiatives to boost domestic defence production and exports. The company plans to leverage its shipyard and expand facilities to meet growing demand for naval vessels and other military equipment.

title: ITC shares slip over 5% after BAT's Rs 11,600 crore stake sale plan
content: ITC shares experienced a decline of over 5% following reports that British American Tobacco (BAT), the largest shareholder, plans to sell a 2.3% stake in the company through a block deal valued at over Rs 11,600 crore. This sale will reduce BAT's holding in ITC to 23.1%, with the Indian government becoming the largest shareholder group.

title: Ahead of IPO nod, NSE valuation surges 60% to $58 bn
content: The National Stock Exchange of India's valuation has soared to $58 billion in private markets, fueled by anticipation of a potential IPO. Institutional and high-net-worth investors are aggressively purchasing unlisted shares, expecting a listing this year.

title: PM Modi to visit four states on May 29-30: What's on his agenda?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to embark on a four-state tour starting May 28, 2025, encompassing Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar, and Uttar Pradesh. He will inaugurate and lay the foundation stones for numerous development projects across these states, focusing on infrastructure, energy, and connectivity. These projects aim to boost economic growth, improve living standards, and enhance regional connectivity.

title: Parking dispute turns violent: UP man bites off nose of society secretary
content: A parking dispute at Ratan Planet Apartment in Kanpur escalated into a violent altercation, resulting in a resident biting off the nose of the society's secretary, Rupendra Singh Yadav. The incident occurred after Kshitij Mishra allegedly assaulted Yadav following a disagreement over a parking spot.

title: Watch: Jitesh’s fiery reply to LSG star — the helmet drama you can't miss
content: Jitesh Sharma's explosive 85 propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a thrilling victory over Lucknow Super Giants, chasing down 228 and securing a Qualifier 1 spot. Sharma's celebration mirrored Avesh Khan's past actions, adding drama to the win. RCB will now face Punjab Kings, while Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians will battle in the eliminator after this crucial final league match.

title: Are you making her a criminal? Release girl held over online post on India-Pak: HC
content: The Bombay High Court intervened in the case of a 19-year-old student. She was arrested for an online post about India-Pakistan relations. The court ordered her immediate release from Yerwada prison. Judges criticized the college's rustication order and the police's actions. The court allowed her to take her exams.

title: 'Will break his bones': Kolkata taxi driver harasses and scams American YouTuber
content: Dustin, a YouTuber exploring Kolkata, faced a harrowing experience with a taxi driver who intentionally took him to the wrong hotel and then attempted to overcharge him. The situation escalated when another man threatened Dustin with violence and mafia connections, demanding additional money. Despite the ordeal, Dustin maintained a positive outlook on India, recognizing the incident as an isolated issue.

title: SpaceX launches Starship but loses control within 30 mins: Watch video
content: SpaceX launched its Starship Super Heavy system from Starbase in South Texas. The flight aimed to gather data on the rocket's structural limits. A previously launched Super Heavy booster powered the Starship flight. SpaceX lost communication with the booster during descent. Payload doors malfunctioned during mid-flight. Starship spun out of control, resulting in a catastrophic re-entry.

title: Delhi woman among 2 killed as tree falls on them at Tiger Falls in Dehradun
content: A tragic incident at Tiger Falls in Chakrata, Dehradun, resulted in the deaths of two individuals, including a tourist from Delhi. Alka Anand and Gitaram Joshi were fatally struck by a falling tree while bathing in the popular waterfall.

title: Watch: SpaceX’s Starship spirals uncontrollably as fuel leaks in dramatic footage
content: SpaceX's Starship ninth test flight reached orbit but faced challenges, including a payload bay door malfunction and a fuel tank leak. The Super Heavy booster exploded before splashdown, and the upper-stage vehicle spun uncontrollably due to fuel leaks. Despite these issues and a scrapped engine demonstration, Starship is heading towards the Indian Ocean, but its heat shield's survival is uncertain.

title: Son, 8, stuck in lift, Bhopal man dies of shock
content: In Bhopal, a 51-year-old man, Rishiraj Bhatnagar, tragically died of a heart attack after his young son became trapped in an elevator due to a power outage. Bhatnagar collapsed while instructing the security guard to activate the generator. The child was rescued safely when power was restored within minutes, but Bhatnagar could not be saved.

title: Golden dome or $61 billion? Trump gives Canada stark choice
content: Donald Trump suggests Canada become the 51st US state to join the 'Golden Dome' missile defense system for free. Otherwise, it will cost $61 billion. Canada has shown interest in the system. It is seen as vital for North American early warning capabilities. Mark Carney rejects the statehood proposal. The future of the defense system is uncertain without Canada's support.

title: Covid-19: Are XFG, NB.1.8.1, and LF.7 variants more transmissible? Symptoms & severity
content: India is witnessing an increase in COVID-19 cases, with the total number of active infections reaching 1,010, as per latest reports. Among the states, Kerala is experiencing the highest surge, followed by Maharashtra, Delhi, and Gujarat. While health officials maintain that the situation is under control, the emergence of new variants is being closely monitored. The variants under scrutiny include NB.1.8.1 and LF.7, with XFG also being a "variant of interest"

title: 'Tamil gave birth to Kannada': Kamal Hassan remarks triggers massive row
content: Karnataka BJP President B Y Vijayendra has demanded an apology from actor Kamal Haasan for his remark that “Tamil gave birth to Kannada.” Vijayendra condemned Haasan's statement as disrespectful to Kannadigas and an insult to the Kannada language, emphasising its rich history and significance.

title: India-US discuss trade: Foreign secy Vikram Misri meets under secy Jeffrey Kessler
content: Vikram Misri and Jeffrey Kessler met to boost India-US tech ties. They discussed holding strategic trade talks soon. This follows Narendra Modi's US visit earlier this year. Both nations launched COMPACT to enhance collaboration. India aims to finalize trade deals with the US before July. Piyush Goyal visited the US last week for trade discussions.

title: Rishabh Pant, LSG handed heavy fine after IPL match against RCB
content: Lucknow Super Giants skipper Rishabh Pant has been penalised Rs 30 lakh for a slow over rate during their defeat to Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Other playing XI members, including the Impact Player, received a Rs 12 lakh fine. This marks LSG's third over-rate offence this season.

title: Gold price today: Why is gold rate showing signs of exhaustion? Should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have fluctuated due to global uncertainties and developments in trade relations, particularly regarding US tariffs. Recent progress in trade negotiations and outflows from gold ETFs suggest a potential consolidation in the short term.

title: OPT students in US face deportation threat over employment data lapse
content: International students in the US on OPT are facing potential deportation due to stricter enforcement of SEVIS reporting rules. ICE is issuing letters threatening termination for those not promptly updating employment information, particularly regarding unemployment days.

title: Eid Ul adha 2025 Moon Sighting: Dhul Hijjah crescent sighted in Saudi Arabia
content: This act of devotion is now celebrated as "Eid ul-Adha", where muslims all across the world, sacrifice an animal, typically a goat on this day. The meat from the sacrifice is then shared among family, friends, and those in need, symbolizing generosity and compassion, and the desire to help one and all.

title: Nifty50 above 24,850; BSE Sensex flat in opening trade
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday but the market quickly moved to the green territory. While Nifty50 was above 24,850, BSE Sensex was marginally up.

title: Interpol issues first silver notice at India’s request in visa fraud case
content: Interpol, at India's request, has issued a Silver notice to monitor Shubham Shokeen, a former French embassy officer involved in visa fraud, to track illicit assets globally. Shokeen allegedly collected illegal payments for Schengen visas and acquired Dubai properties with the proceeds. India has also secured a Silver notice against Amit Madanlal Lakhanpal for cryptocurrency fraud.

title: Kiran Mazumdar ditches car, hops on Bengaluru metro with Exxon Mobil’s ‘Iron Lady’
content: Biocon founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw opted for the Namma Metro's Purple Line to bypass Bengaluru's notorious traffic, traveling from Whitefield to Vidhana Soudha. She lauded the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) for the seamless journey, accompanied by Jennifer Erich of Exxon Mobil. The initiative drew praise online, highlighting the importance of public transport usage across all societal levels.

title: Rajasthan board class 10 result: Check official websites to download scorecards
content: The Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) will announce the Class 10th results for 2025 today, May 28, at 4:30 PM. Over 11 lakh students participated in the exams held from March 6 to April 4. Results can be accessed via official websites like rajeduboard.rajasthan.gov.in, with scorecards also available through SMS and DigiLocker.

title: Ugly handshake! Pakistan player’s shocking gesture towards Indian tennis star
content: India triumphed over Pakistan in the Junior Davis Cup with a 2-0 victory, highlighted by Prkaash Sarran and Tavish Pahwa's singles wins. A video later emerged showing a Pakistani player's unsportsmanlike handshake, contrasting with the Indian player's calm reaction. After initially missing the handshake, the Pakistani player made contact the second time, only to pull away abruptly in a seemingly disrespectful manner.

title: Retrieval of Katchchatheevu is the only permanent solution to T.N. fishermen’s woes, reiterates CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin recalled the recent special resolution adopted by the Tamil Nadu Assembly, insisting on the retrieval of the islet from Sri Lanka

title: Govt. notifies rules enabling greater jointness and command efficiency in armed forces
content: The Act empowers the Commanders-in-Chief and Officers-in-Command of the ISOs to exercise command and control over the service personnel serving under them, ensuring effective maintenance of discipline and administration within the organisations.

title: More than 40 MLAs ready to form new Government in Manipur, converge at Imphal Raj Bhavan
content: Manipur has been under President's Rule since February after BJP leader N Biren Singh resigned as the Chief Minister, amid criticisms about his government's handling of the ethnic clashes

title: Bihar court sentences BJP MLA to 2 years in jail over criminal intimidation case
content: Mishri Lal Yadav, who represents the district's Alinagar constituency, and his associate Suresh Yadav, were in 2019 accused by a local resident of assault and snatching cash.

title: Anna University sexual assault case: T.N. CM Stalin welcomes judgment; says Opposition’s attempts at ‘cheap politics’ demolished
content: Mr. Stalin appreciated the police force for completing investigation into the sexual assault case and getting justice within five months.

title: Mumbai rains: BMC imposes penalty on contractors for failure to operate pumping stations
content: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has imposed a fine of ₹10 lakhs each on the operators, who were responsible for the operation of four pumping stations at Hindmata, Gandhi Market, Yellow Gate, and Chunabhatti, totalling ₹40 lakh.

title: Supreme Court gives interim bail to 23-year-old influencer in rape case
content: The Supreme Court said this is a fit case to grant interim bail as the accused has been in jail for nine months and charges have not been framed in the case

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Tamil Nadu government’s measures ensured speedy justice, says DMK leader R.S. Bharathi
content: The government put forth strong arguments in the case before the court and ensured a speedy judgement, Mr. Bharathi said.

title: Kerala tribal family has narrow escape after wild tusker destroys their shed
content: Kuttampuzha panchayat remains one of the worst affected panchayats from human-animal conflict in Ernakulam district

title: Ashoka University professor’s interim bail extended; SC says he has right to speech but can’t comment on FIRs
content: The interim bail condition imposed on Professor Mahmudabad was that he would not write or make any speech related to his contentious social media posts on Operation Sindoor

title: Kerala government enlists volunteers to rid beaches of plastic detritus from capsized Liberian ship
content: Government to consult experts to help mitigate shipwreck-related risks, including oil spillage and leak of hazardous chemicals

title: Nilambur bypoll in Kerala: P.V. Anvar threatens to field Trinamool candidate if UDF continues to ‘ignore’ him
content: Mr. Anvar blames Leader of Opposition V.D. Satheesan for ‘insulting him’ by maintaining uncertainty over his role in and relations with UDF

title: Break your silence: Congress to PM on U.S.’ repeated claims about India-Pakistan ‘ceasefire’
content: Congress general secretary questions whether U.S. Commerce Secretary Luttnick’s statement in the U.S. Court of International Trade on May 23rd, 2025, claims President Trump used tariff power to broker a ‘tenuous ceasefire’

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends transfer of Chief Justices of Rajasthan, Tripura, Jharkhand and Madras High Courts
content: The collegium has also recommended transfer of Justice Tadakamalla Vinod Kumar to the Madras High Court from the Telangana High Court.

title: After Pahalgam, Omar Abdullah to hold meeting in Jammu & Kashmir's Gulmarg
content: Jammu & Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah chairs meeting in Gulmarg to boost tourism post-terror attack, emphasising security and trust for visitors

title: Delhi Ridge tree-felling case: SC finds DDA officials guilty of criminal contempt, but holds its hand considering CAPFIMS’ ‘overarching public interest’
content: The Supreme Court also asked the DDA to impose a one-time levy on affluent persons residing in the Ridge area who benefitted from the widening of the road.

title: Two men face prison for human smuggling after death of Indian family of four on U.S.-Canada border
content: Federal prosecutors have recommended nearly 20 years in prison for the alleged ringleader, Harshkumar Ramanlal Patel, and nearly 11 years for the driver, who was supposed to pick the family up, Steve Anthony Shand

title: 4 militants arrested in Manipur
content: Arrests of militants from banned groups in Manipur, recovery of arms and ammunition by security forces reported

title: Increased outward FDI by Indian companies ‘warrants attention’: Finance Ministry
content: ‘That Indian overseas direct investment increased nearly by $12.5 billion during the year FY25, even as uncertainty reigned in the world, warrants attention, especially given their cautious attitude towards domestic investment,’ the Department of Economic Affairs of the Ministry of Finance noted in its Monthly Economic Review released on May 27, 2025.

title: PM Modi on four-state tour to launch development projects
content: The Prime Minister launches development projects in four states — Sikkim, West Bengal, Bihar and Uttar Pradesh — focusing on infrastructure, energy, and healthcare

title: France together with India in fight against terror: Ravi Shankar Prasad-led team concludes Paris visit
content: “They totally agreed that France and India, indeed the whole democratic world, need to speak in one voice in the fight against terrorism emanating from Pakistan and supported by the Pakistani state,” Mr. Prasad said

title: Senior lawyers should not argue cases during summer recess: Supreme Court
content: A bench comprising Justices B.V. Nagarathna and Satish Chandra Sharma said  junior lawyers should be given opportunities during vacation.

title: Nadpalu in Udupi district records second highest rainfall in Karnataka
content: The highest rainfall of 145.5 mm was reported from Haanagallu Gram Panchayat in Somwarpet taluk of Kodagu district

title: Tejashwi Yadav’s baby boy has been named ‘Iraj’: Lalu Prasad
content: In a post on X, Mr. Prasad said, ‘So our grand daughter Katyayani’s little brother is named ‘Iraj’ by me and Rabri Devi. Tejashwi and Rajshree have given him full name as ‘Iraj Lalu’.

title: COVID-19: Karnataka records 36 positive cases
content: According to a bulletin issued by the Health Department, while the positivity rate in the last 24 hours is 9.44%, total tests done in Karnataka in the last 24 hours is 381

title: Bantwal murder: Case booked against 15 persons
content: One person died on the spot while another was admitted to a private hospital in Mangaluru for treatment of injuries

title: SC collegium recommends Telangana HC Acting CJ’s transfer to Calcutta HC
content: All the three judges were with the Telangana High Court when they were transferred to Karnataka and Patna High Courts earlier.

title: Kamal Haasan nominated as Makkal Needhi Maiam candidate for Rajya Sabha polls
content: The ruling DMK had allotted one Rajya Sabha seat to the MNM during negotiations before the Lok Sabha elections in 2024

title: DMK announces three candidates for Rajya Sabha elections; allots one seat to Kamal Haasan
content: In a statement, DMK president and Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin re-nominated incumbent MP P. Wilson, and announced S.R. Sivalingam and A. Rokkaiah Malik, better known as poet Salma, as candidates

title: Arunachal Pradesh reports first Covid-19 case of current wave
content: A 34-year-old pregnant woman and her mother tested positive for COVID-19; health department monitoring closely

title: Bad road claims life in West Bengal’s Asansol
content: Protests erupt in Sonarpur over poor road conditions as locals block road for hours demanding immediate action

title: Two Indian peacekeepers to be honoured posthumously on International Peacekeepers Day
content: Brigadier General Amitabh Jha, who served with the U.N. Disengagement Observer Force (UNDOF), and Havildar Sanjay Singh, who was deployed with the U.N. Stabilisation Mission in the Democratic Republic of Congo (MONUSCO), will be honoured posthumously with the Dag Hammarskjold medal

title: Kamal Haasan sparks outrage with ‘Kannada came from Tamil’ claim, BJP demands apology
content: Intended perhaps as a gesture of cultural unity, the comment has since instead stirred accusations of linguistic arrogance and disrespect

title: State Information Commissioner picks of Haryana govt. opposed by INLD
content: A petition was also filed in the Punjab and Haryana High Court on Monday by an advocate challenging the appointments.

title: Plastic pellets found on Kerala coast after shipwreck pose serious environmental impact, warn experts
content: While not inherently toxic, pellets remain a dangerous pollutant. Their short- and long-term impacts include habitat contamination and their breaking up into micro and nano plastics and entering food chain, say experts

title: Will fight tooth and nail against inclusion of Marathas in OBC category, says Bhujbal
content: The OBC leader claimed that the Maratha community wields a lot of influence in the State and gets reservation benefits, and 60% of Maharashtra’s MLAs and Ministers hail from the Maratha community

title: Rains LIVE: IMD issues red alert for Wayanad, Kozhikode; heavy rain likely in Mumbai
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah orders district in-charge Ministers to inspect flood-hit areas; IMD forecasts heavy rainfall in Kerala

title: Protest rally against Mahadayi basin projects in Belagavi on June 3
content: Environmentalists, farmers and leaders of various organisations launched the ‘Our Water Our Right’ campaign, and vowed to fight against projects that had the potential to damage the fragile ecosystem of the Western Ghats

title: Three students from Mysuru excel at 2024-25 Olympiad awards
content: The first rank in international mathematics Olympiad carrying a gold medal and a merit certificate was bagged by V. Sidhvik from KNC Innovative Global School

title: Scientists and experts seek PM’s intervention in lifting US curb on biodegradable dinnerware made from areca leaf sheath
content: Over 100 scientists, medical experts and academicians from the areca-growing areas write to PM seeking diplomatic and regulatory steps

title: Suspension of former CID Additional DG N. Sanjay extended by six months
content: The IPS officer is facing charges of misappropriation and misuse of public funds and has been booked under Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988

title: Request for cinema ticket price hike must come through proper channels, says A.P. Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: Pawan suggests Cinematography Minister to inquire into theatre bandh row; issues of pricey food and beverages in theatres need to be probed, he says

title: Unaided schools oppose fee reimbursement plan for students admitted under RTE Act
content: They accuse State govt. of failure in fulfilling its obligationon reimbursement of the fees of these children in the last three years

title: A.P. DGP inaugurates Shakthi Whatsapp number for women safety unveiled
content: Shakthi Whatsapp Number will work round-the-clock, says Women and Child Safety Wing IGP, B. Raja Kumari

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri meets U.S. Under Secretary Jeffrey Kessler in Washington
content: The Indian Embassy in Washington said Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri met U.S. Under Secretary Jeffrey Kessler to advance cooperation in critical and emerging technologies

title: India has no interest in war but terrorists must not go unpunished: Shashi Tharoor in Panama
content: “We do believe, unfortunately, that this problem (terrorist attacks sponsored by Pakistan) is not over and if there is another terrorist incident tomorrow, we believe that we will not have to come back here, we will have your understanding in advance,” Mr Tharoor said

title: Farmers of the sea: India’s dugongs must stay a conservation priority
content: Once widespread in Indian waters, dugong numbers have fallen to an estimated 200 individuals, with both their population and geographic range on the wane

title: Jaipur Police supports victims of crime by linking them to benefactors
content: Contributions include sponsoring the education of affected children, skill development for adults, and monthly assistance until families achieve self-sufficiency

title: All-party delegation led by MP Kanimozhi arrives in Greece
content: The delegation reached Athens from Slovenia, where it called on senior officials and emphasised India's "new normal" of zero tolerance against cross-border terrorism

title: INDIA bloc to seek special session on Pahalgam attack
content: They are finalising a draft of the letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the issue; they want discussion on the attack and the subsequent developments both nationally and internationally

title: Bengal govt. slapped us with punishment postings: doctors
content: Senior residents say the move came as a backlash for protesting against the government over R.G. Kar incident

title: WB government to start fresh recruitment as well as push for review petition before SC simultaneously, says Mamata
content: Fresh hiring for over 44,000 posts is set to begin by May 30 as directed by apex court, while parallel review will be sought for over 25,000 whose appointments were cancelled over ‘tainted’ selection.

title: Om Birla nominates Sambit Patra, two other Lok Sabha members to Press Council
content: Besides Patra, Shiv Sena member Naresh Mhaske and Congress member Kali Charan Munda have been nominated to the Press Council

title: Sequenced COVID-19 samples in Tamil Nadu in were of Omicron and its sub-lineages: Director of Public Health
content: Reiterating that there was no need for panic, Dr. T.S. Selvavinayagam says if any one has displays symptoms, especially persons with co-morbidities or the elderly, immediate medical help must be sought at hospitals

title: BSF’s border management system shows encouraging results during Operation Sindoor: IG Shashank Anand
content: Fencing with sensors allows real-time monitoring in tough terrain, says IG; will work to improve limitations in the counter-drone system, as this is a major challenge during Operation Sindoor, says DIG

title: ‘Mane Manege Police’ initiative to bridge the gap between the force and citizens
content: Parameshwara says the beat police will visit houses, interact with people and help resolve the issues being faced by them

title: BSF foils Bangladeshi nationals’ bid to enter India
content: The incident took place in western Assam during the reported deportation of 14 Bangladeshi nationals who were staying in India illegally

title: Menstrual education in Karnataka advanced from high school to middle school
content: Teachers at many government and private schools said they have already begun teaching students about menstruation, menstrual hygiene, and other bodily changes that occur around puberty from class 5 or 6.

title: Applications for arts and science colleges to be open till May 30
content: The merit list for special category students will be released on May 29, and the one for general category students will be out on May 30

title: Varanasi court rejects plea against Rahul over his remarks on Lord Ram in U.S.
content: Plea accused Cong. leader of referring to Lord Ram as a “mythological and fictional character,” and said the same had  hurt the religious sentiments of Hindus

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Pacers go up 3-1 on the Knicks
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Haliburton's historic triple-double keys Game 4 win
content: Tyrese Haliburton had 32 points, 15 assists and 12 rebounds without a turnover for a historic playoff triple-double in the Pacers' Game 4 win over the Knicks on Tuesday night.

title: Perry, 40, helps Oilers to cusp of Cup Final return
content: Veteran forward Corey Perry, 40, scored the tiebreaking goal on a power play in the second period, as the Edmonton Oilers defeated the Dallas Stars 4-1 on Tuesday night to take a 3-1 lead in the Western Conference finals headed into Thursday's Game 5.

title: Bradshaw: Steelers' interest in Rodgers 'a joke'
content: Four-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback Terry Bradshaw, a Steelers legend, isn't a fan of the Pittsburgh's pursuit of Aaron Rodgers, telling an Arkansas radio station on Tuesday that the club's interest in the 41-year-old signal-caller "is just a joke."

title: CFP 5+11 model draws interest from SEC coaches
content: In a pivot from the push for automatic qualifiers in the next iteration of the College Football Playoff, the SEC on Tuesday took a heightened interest in a 16-team model that would include the five highest-ranked conference champions and 11 at-large bids.

title: WNBA can't verify hateful comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA said it was unable to substantiate allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed toward Angel Reese during a game against the Fever.

title: Kemp pleads guilty to assault charge in shooting
content: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp, 55, a six-time NBA All-Star, pleaded guilty to an assault charge Tuesday for shooting at two men inside a vehicle in a Washington state mall parking lot, and he is now due to be sentenced in August in Tacoma, Washington.

title: 📈 Ranking top 25 NBA free agents: Who's No. 1?
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

title: Game 4 grades, takeaways: Edmonton takes commanding series lead
content: What we learned and what's ahead for the Oilers, who lead the Stars 3-1 in the Western Conference finals.

title: The NFL season is almost here ... sort of: 100 days out, we have storylines, predictions and players to know
content: There are 100 days until the 2025  season kicks off. Let's celebrate with 100 big thoughts, predictions, stats and situations to watch.

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: Indiana's losses drop the Fever while Seattle's three-win streak bumps up the Storm in our latest 1-13 ranking.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: Who has the early edge for MVP, Cy Young and more? Inside the numbers on MLB's biggest awards
content: With Memorial Day weekend behind us, it's time to take our first look at the leaders for MVP, Cy Young and more.

title: Memorial Day standings check: Playoff predictions, biggest surprises, more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?﻿
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Ranking all head coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

title: Is this the last time we'll see line judges at a Grand Slam?
content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Summer transfers each top Premier League club should make
content: All of the big Premier League clubs need to make big moves in this summer transfer window -- even the good ones. Here's what they should do.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: LaLiga awards: The Year of Yamal as Barça dominate
content: With the sun set on LaLiga for 2024-25, ESPN hands out silverware for the best and worst of the season. No prizes for guessing who hogs the headlines.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League season grades: How well did the 20 teams do?
content: Which teams passed and which failed to make the grade during the 2024-25 season? Ian Darke has the answers.

title: Sources: Man United trigger Cunha release clause
content: Wolverhampton Wanderers have given Manchester United permission to conclude a deal for Matheus Cunha, sources told ESPN.

title: Messi partners with Suárez to launch new team
content: Luis Suárez and Lionel Messi have been partners on the pitch for several years. Now they're teaming up off it as businessmen.

title: Pellegrini: Antony wanted 'revenge' after Utd exit
content: Brazilian winger Antony wanted "revenge" when he arrived on loan at Real Betis after struggling to live up to his hefty price tag at Manchester United, Betis head coach Manuel Pellegrini said Tuesday.

title: Roma: Drunk Zaniolo hospitalized 2 youth players
content: Roma accused Nicolò Zaniolo of hospitalising two of their youth players while intoxicated in what they termed "violent and unjustifiable behaviour."

title: St. Louis City sacks Mellberg after poor start
content: St. Louis City SC fired manager Olof Mellberg after just six months following a dismal start to the MLS season that left the team in 14th place in the Western Conference.

title: Chelsea eye history in Conference League final
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says Wednesday's Conference League final is a chance to make history, reinforce a winning mentality and prove his young side belong at the top.

title: LAFC great Vela retires, named club ambassador
content: Former Mexico and LAFC forward Carlos Vela announced his retirement from soccer on Tuesday, with the 36-year-old to become LAFC's first club ambassador.

title: Barça phenom Yamal inks new long-term contract
content: Lamine Yamal has agreed a new long-term contract with Barcelona until 2031, the Spanish champions announced on Tuesday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Cherki
content: Manchester City are keeping tabs ahead of a possible move for Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Goodbye Manchester, hello trophies: Nine ex-United stars who won elsewhere in 2024-25
content: Scott McTominay won an MVP prize in Italy, Dean Henderson won the FA Cup with Crystal Palace, and either Jadon Sancho or Antony will win the UEFA Europa Conference League crown this week. Who else cast out by United has thrived this season?

title: Bullpen stock watch: Andrés Muñoz remains the perfect closer
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: She Was In Pahalgam An Hour Before April 22 Terror Attack. Her Message For PM
content: A Singaporean national of Indian origin had a narrow escape during the ghastly terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam last month.

title: Russia, Ukraine Hold First Direct Peace Talks In Over 3 Years In Turkey
content: Russian and Ukrainian negotiators met in Istanbul on Friday at their first direct peace talks in more than three years, under pressure from US President Donald Trump to end Europe's deadliest conflict since World War Two.

title: "Kannada Has Long-Standing History": Siddaramaiah On Kamal Haasan's Remarks
content: Kamal Haasan is unaware of the history of Kannada, said Chief Minister Siddaramaiah today, after a remark by the Tamil megastar snowballed into a wider language controversy.

title: Global Acute Hunger Hits New High, Outlook 'Bleak' For 2025: UN-Backed Report
content: More than 295 million people faced acute hunger last year, a new high driven by conflict along with other crises -- and the outlook is "bleak" for 2025 as humanitarian aid falters, a UN-backed report said Friday.

title: What The Hidden Rhythms Of Orangutan Calls Tell Us About Language
content: In the dense forests of Indonesia, you can hear strange and haunting sounds. At first, these calls may seem like a random collection of noises  but my rhythmic analyses reveal a different story.

title: Biden Book Exposes How 'Gerontocracy' Is Weakening US Democracy
content: As a damning expose on Joe Biden's cognitive decline scandalizes Washington, Democrats in Congress are facing their own reckoning over a seniority system that critics say is holding back younger talent.

title: "Whoop This Girl's A**": Women Secret Service Agents Fight Near Barack Obama's Home
content: Two uniformed officers of the US Secret Service have been suspended following a physical altercation outside former President Barack Obama's Washington, DC, home.

title: "The Colour Of Sindoor...": Shashi Tharoor's Speech Draws Dig From Own Party
content: Terrorists targeting India have realised in recent years that they will have to pay, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor told a gathering in Panama City today, as the Indian delegation led by him reached the Latin American nation

title: Elon Musk Reveals What Led To SpaceX Starship Crash Into Indian Ocean
content: Billionaire Elon Musk's commercial space flight company, SpaceX, suffered another setback on Sunday after its ninth Starship test flight exploded over the Indian Ocean just 30 minutes after the uncrewed rocket was launched into space from Texas.

title: On Camera, UP Man Bites Off Neighbour's Nose In Parking Row
content: An argument over a parking space in a high-rise residential society in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur led to a flat owner allegedly biting the nose of the society's secretary during a confrontation.

title: Sunset Magic: New York To Witness Manhattanhenge On These Dates
content: Twice a year, the setting sun aligns perfectly with NYC's street grid and sinks below the horizon framed in canyon of skyscrapers known as Manhattanhenge.

title: Explained: Why Are YouTubers Accusing News Agency ANI Of Extortion?
content: News agency Asian News International (ANI) has been accused by content creators of trying to extort lakhs for a few seconds of their copyrighted video content, which the creator community argues is against the principle of fair use.

title: "Single Hand Can't Clap": Supreme Court Grants Interim Bail In Rape Case
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday gave interim bail to a 23-year-old accused of raping a 40-year-old, noting that charges had not been framed even though he has been in jail for nine months.

title: Joel Le Scouarnec: French 'Devil' Surgeon Who Practised Unhindered For Decades
content: A French court is to give its verdict in the trial of a surgeon who admitted to sexually abusing hundreds of patients over more than two decades, in one of the country's largest child sex abuse cases.

title: Slightly Radioactive Fukushima Soil To Be Used In Prime Minister's Garden
content: Japan plans to reuse slightly radioactive Fukushima nuclear plant on flower beds at Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's office to show it is safe, to counter public concerns.

title: Accused In Anna University Sex Assault Case Found Guilty Of All 11 Charges
content: Gnanasekharan, a biryani vendor, has been found guilty of sexually assaulting a 19-year-old student at Chennais Anna University. Mahila Court convicted him of all 11 charges, including blackmailing, and is yet to pronounce the punishment.

title: In This Country, Fliers Who Stand Up Too Soon After Landing Will Be Fined
content: If you are travelling to Turkey, avoid getting up immediately after the plane lands. It might cost you money.

title: Southeast Asia Sees Nearly 150% Rise in Heart Disease, Study Shows
content: The number of people with cardiovascular disease surged by 148 per cent in Southeast Asia over the past three decades, with the condition becoming the region's leading cause of mortality and morbidity, according to new research.

title: Trump's Seabed Mining Push Raises Threats Over Global Ocean Laws
content: Donald Trump's move to sidestep global regulations and begin pushing for seabed mining in international waters could pose a wider threat of competing countries claiming sovereignty over the ocean, experts say.

title: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Veer Savarkar On His Birth Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday paid homage to revolutionary freedom fighter Vinayak Damodar Savarkar, popularly known as Veer Savarkar, on his birth anniversary.

title: PGA Tour axes Tour Championship staggered start
content: the PGA Tour is eliminating the controversial starting-strokes format from the Tour Championship . all 30 players in the field will start at even par in a stroke-play tournament . the winner after 72 holes will capture the FedEx Cup and collect a bonus .
